feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Accessing Loading step for Outbound Delivery flow in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
We are working on S/4HANA Cloud Starter System (EWM – Public Cloud).
Outbound delivery processing is available and preconfigured for Packing and Goods Issue.

However, we are facing an issue with the Loading step in the outbound flow.

Expected Process Flow:
OBD → Picking → Packing → Loading → Goods Issue
(Picking and Loading to be executed via RF Device)

Issue Observed:

  • Outbound Delivery is created and distributed to EWM successfully

  • Picking and Packing are available

  • Loading step is not triggered / not accessible

  • RF-based Loading is not determined

  • Goods Issue can be posted without explicit Loading


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Ehanced limits for PO is not applicable for invoices
entry.content:
Hello experts ,

 

we are using sap public cloud and when we create a ses po and set enhanced limit for eg :5000eur and when we create a invoice as reference PO it is allowing n number of time more than the value limit with one PO value of 5000eur we have created The invoice for almost 470000eur .

can we handle this and make setting as error when we post most than the enhanced limit.

entry.title: Create Purchasing Contract with conditions via API Purchase Contracts (Version 2)
entry.content:
Hello SAP,

We are trying to create purchasing contracts with conditions, i.e., entities:

  • A_PurContrItmCndnAmountType (Item Condition Amount)
  • A_PurContrItmCndnScalesType (Item Condition Scales)
  • A_PurContrItmCndnValdtyType (Item COndition Validity)

However, the interface Purchase Contracts (Version 2) / API_PURCHASECONTRACT_PROCESS_SRV;v=2 provided for this purpose does not seem to support conditions during initial creation. Unfortunately, we cannot find any meaningful documentation and are therefore wondering whether this is generally not technically possible or what method we need to use to create purchasing contracts with conditions in SAP.

It is important to note that these conditions should be different from those created in the purchasing info record. In other words, from a technical/business perspective, we are getting even better purchasing conditions in the purchasing contract than in the purchasing info record.

In short: How can purchasing contracts with conditions from another external system be created

entry.title: Valuation Price Field Is Read-Only for Items Sourced from Product Catalog
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I'm currently working with the new Fiori application F1639A – My Purchase Requisitions (New) and have encountered a challenge:

Requirement: I need to source items from the Catalog but also modify the "Valuation Price" field before creating the requisition.

Previous Solution: In the deprecated application, we successfully achieved this by removing the Catalog ID through a BADI implementation.

Current Issue: This approach no longer seems to work in the new application.

Has anyone found a workaround or alternative solution to enable editing of the Valuation Price for catalog-sourced items in F1639A? 

Any guidance or suggestions would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance for your help.

entry.title: Intercompany Invoice IDoc not posting gainst the original Purchase Order in S/4HANA Public
entry.content:
We are working with an SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud intercompany scenario and have encountered unexpected behavior regarding how the incoming intercompany supplier invoice is posted in the receiving company code.

Our Scenario (Public Cloud – Intercompany PO → Outbound Delivery → Invoice)

  1. Company Code A creates an Intercompany Purchase Order to Company Code Company Code B.
  2. In Company Code B, the system automatically generates the Intercompany Outbound Delivery.
  3. Company Code B posts the Intercompany Billing Document, which in turn triggers an IDoc toward Company Code A.
  4. The IDoc is successfully processed in Company Code A and creates a Journal Entry.

The Issue

Although the accounting document is created correctly in Company Code A, it is not linked to the original Purchase Order.
We expected the invoice posting via IDoc to update or reference the PO, but the journal entry contains no PO number, no PO item, and no PO history update. But we can see it in the message that the references are in the iDoc. But we do not see it in the PO document flow. 

 

 

Our question

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, should the IDoc-based incoming intercompany supplier invoice post directly against the original Purchase Order in the receiving company?

  • If yes, which configuration or business setting ensures that the IDoc updates the PO history?
  • If no, what is the expected standard system behavior in Public Cloud, and is the journal entry intentionally not linked to the PO?

Any insights, updated documentation references, or examples from other Public Cloud systems would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance for your help!

entry.title: Need to know how can Return Revenue GL can be assigned Different Return Revenue GL
entry.content:
Dear Community,

Our requirement is to set the different revenue GL for return processing for credit memo. In this case, how can we achieve this requirement through standard behavior? If this can't be achieved in a standard way, then how could we achieve this? 

Need to Assign for Return Order (CBAR or CBRE) for Credit Memo.


--- Steps to Reproduce ---

1. Create a return order type through CBAR/CBRE, where we will use the reference document as an invoice document. 

2. Create Outbound Delivery and PGR 

3. Create Credit Memo (Accounting Impacted: the Revenue GL for Return is Debit, and the Reconciliation Account for Customer would be Credit).

Thank you for your inputs!

entry.title: Delegated budget holders for large project - clean core, SE workflows
entry.content:
@corina thanks for this 2602 projects update. One thing we are looking for a while already is having the ability to have delegated budgetholders assigned to WBSs within 1 project. Now all SE workflows go to project mgnr which is for large projects not helpful.

If anyone else found a way to add delegated budgetholders in project structure which can still be used in Service Entry workflows, is clean core without needing extensibility we are keen to hear this.

entry.title: Business Context to Outgoing Checks (FIN_FO_PAYM_CHECK_US)
entry.content:
Hi,

I have a request to add some custom fields when create a check, but I'm unable to find a Business Context for both custom fields and custom logic.

Form: FIN_FO_PAYM_CHECK_US

Data Source: FDP_FFO_PAYM_CHECK_SRV

Apps: Manage Automatic Payments, Manage Outgoing checks

Is it available at all?

entry.title: Open Items using plant and company code as separate business partners in intercompany processes
entry.content:
Hello, 
we have a question on the 2TS process - probably this is valid also for oder intercompany processes related to logistic. The plant is set up as a businesspartner in the intercompany processes, in addition to the company code business partner, all businesspartner related to one intercompany partner have the same trading partner. In SAP standard  SAP the business partner for the plant are set up like this. They are even set up as business partner for their own sales org. This is how its set up in the SAP Starter System where we tested.
 

 

 
The business parter for the corresponding company code (30401010) from SAP standard, Is set up like this:

 

Depending on the intercompany scenario eiter the plant or the company code business parter is used. This results in the following postings/customer line items:
Red square: totally wrong from our point of view, we do not know who tested it, but the system should not even allow to have open items in the own company. 
Beside that we do not understand the thoughts behind having a business partner for the company code and one for the plant, from finance point of view. Because for the same legal entity we create open items on different business partners (yellow and orange marked). Can someone explain the logic behind - or have we tested something wrong?
 
Best regards
Anja

entry.content: Hello everyone, Do we have any ability to add 0 as a prefix for EAN Code in materials Public Cloud ? I Managed number ranges but still couldn't add 0 as a prefix.

entry.title: "Release of Purchase Requisition Item" not working sap public cloud
entry.content:
Hi All,

I have a business scenario to approve or reject based on the line items in PR and approved PR line items should be able to proceed with the PO.
Currently I have created the workflow for "Release of purchase requisition item" and assigned myself as the approver.
But I'm not getting any task in my inbox to approve the PR. Also, PR is showing in release status.



Below is the workflow created.



FYI - For overall release of purchase requisition, I'm getting notification in my inbox to approve or reject PR.

Any insight is appreciated.

entry.title: Batches unique at client level for a material - SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
I require an option in SAP Public Cloud to maintain a batch number range that is unique based on the material number. However, I am unable to find the relevant node in the configuration path. Please confirm whether this option is available in SAP Public Cloud or not.

Currently, I can only find the batch number range option at the client level. Due to this, if the GR for Material A is posted with Batch Number 1, then the GR for Material B is assigned Batch Number 2. After that, if I post GR again for Material A, Batch Number 3 is assigned.

Please confirm whether material-wise batch number range configuration is possible in SAP Public Cloud.

entry.title: Balance Sheet/Income Statement - Multidimensional
entry.content:
Good afternoon, I am conducting research in SAP Public Cloud, in the Balance Sheet/Income Statement - Multidimensional application, on whether it is possible to modify the FS Leaf External ID field, as it does not allow me to do so (at least from the application).

I want to modify or, failing that, create the description because it shows the chart of accounts + account relationship, and I would like to delete the YCOA part, but from what I have read, it is an SAP standard and cannot be modified/created.

I don't know if I am missing some configuration setting where I could create or modify it.

I mention this in case I am missing something and someone can help me.

I am attaching a photo with the field I want to modify or create, if possible, marked.

Best regard,

Juan Antonio

entry.title: SAP Cloud - DRC - Custom Statutory Report
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I created a custom Statutory Report, but when I run it, even though it appears correctly in the Legal Reporting section, when I try to view it from Business Partner Reporting, the PDF loads blank.

App: Run Statutory Reports

If I view the PDF through Legal Reporting, it looks like this.

But when I view it through Business Partner Reporting, it looks like this.

I created it this way through the app: Define Statutory Reports.

What could I check to make the correspondence part work correctly?

Thank you very much for your help.
